ayas.translation: By the Dawn,

bismillah.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.

ayas.translation: by the ten nights,
by the Even and the Odd,
by the night when it departs!

ayas.arabic: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
ayas.translation: Is there an oath in that for one possessing intellect?
ayas.transliteration: hal fī dhālika qasamul lidhī ḥijr

ayas.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
ayas.translation: Have you not regarded how your Lord dealt with [the people of] ‘Ad,
ayas.transliteration: alam tara kayfa fa`ala rabbuka bi`ād

ayas.translation: [and] Iram, [the city] of the pillars,

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّتِى لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ
ayas.translation: the like of which was not created among cities,
ayas.transliteration: allatī lam yukhlaq mithluhā fil bilād

ayas.translation: and [the people of] Thamud, who hollowed out the rocks in the valley,
ayas.transliteration: wathamūdal ladhīna jābuṣ ṣakhra bil wād

ayas.translation: and Pharaoh, the impaler
—those who rebelled [against Allah] in their cities
and caused much corruption in them,
so your Lord poured on them lashes of punishment.
Indeed your Lord is in ambush.

ayas.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكْرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَكْرَمَنِ
ayas.translation: As for man, whenever his Lord tests him, and grants him honour, and blesses him, he says, ‘My Lord has honoured me.’
ayas.transliteration: fa-ammal-insānu idhā mab-talāhu rabbuhu fa-akramahu wana``amahu fayaqūlu rabbī akraman

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَهَـٰنَنِ
ayas.translation: But when He tests him and tightens for him his provision, he says, ‘My Lord has humiliated me.’
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammā idhā mab-talāhu faqadara `alayhi rizqahu fayaqūlu rabbī ahānan

ayas.translation: No indeed! No, you do not honour the orphan,
and do not urge the feeding of the needy.
You eat the inheritance rapaciously,
and love wealth with much fondness.

ayas.arabic: كَلَّآ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
ayas.translation: No indeed! When the earth is levelled to a plain,
and your Lord [’s edict] arrives with the angels in ranks,
ayas.transliteration: wajā-a rabbuka wal malaku ṣaffan ṣaffā

ayas.arabic: وَجِا۟ىٓءَ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
ayas.translation: the day when hell is brought [near], man will take admonition on that day, but what will that admonition avail him?
ayas.transliteration: wajī-a yawma-idhin bijahannam ۚ yawma-idhiy yatadhakkarul-insānu wa-annā lahudh dhikrā

ayas.translation: He will say, ‘Alas, had I sent ahead for my life [in the Hereafter]!’
On that day none shall punish as He punishes,
and none shall bind as He binds.
‘O soul at peace!
Return to your Lord, pleased and pleasing!
Then enter among My servants,
and enter My paradise!’
